Class MazeRunner

java.lang.Object
  greenfoot.sofiainternal.Actor
      sofia.graphics.Shape
          sofia.graphics.ImageShape
              sofia.micro.Actor
                  sofia.micro.ProgrammableActor
                      sofia.micro.jeroo.Jeroo
                          MazeRunner
All Implemented Interfaces:
sofia.micro.Program
public class MazeRunner
extends sofia.micro.jeroo.Jeroo

The class here is the subclass of Jeroo known as MazeRunner. In this class, the MazeRunner will execute certain instructions to collect all flowers and remove all nets in any given random island varying from different width, height, number of flowers, and number of nets.

Version:
2.2.1-14 (2013.09.24)
Author:
Christopher Aska Toda (aska192)

          The following methods below is giving instructions to the MazeRunner when it is stuck and so that it can change directions at different situations for example like when it is clear left, clear right, NOT clear ahead, NOT facing east, and NOT facing north will make the MazeRunner turn right.

Constructor Detail

MazeRunner

public MazeRunner()
Creates a new MazeRunner object.

Method Detail

changeRoute

public void changeRoute()
The following methods below is giving instructions to the MazeRunner when it is stuck and so that it can change directions at different situations for example like when it is clear left, clear right, NOT clear ahead, NOT facing east, and NOT facing north will make the MazeRunner turn right. After changing the directions under certain conditions, the Jeroo will keep on executing the program and walk along the path till there are no flowers and nets on the island.

getEndX

public int getEndX()
The code below is declaring an integer boolean and getting the points at the south-east of the island so that it can be assigned to the MazeRunner to stop there. The code getEndX() is implemented on the x-axis or the width and minus 2 to find that coordination at the south-east of the island.

getEndY

public int getEndY()
The code below is declaring an integer boolean and getting the points at the south-east of the island so that it can be assigned to the MazeRunner to stop there. The code getEndY() is implemented on the y-axis or the height and minus 2 to find that coordinatAion at the south-east of the island.

myProgram

public void myProgram()
The code below is myProgram that contains grouped methods and behaviors for the subclass Jeroo, MazeRunner, to execute in the island. The goal for the MazeRunner to be collecting all the flowers and removing all the net in the island and ending at the south-east of the island. The first two codes is assigning variables to the coordinates at the south-east of the island so that the MazeRunner can stop there when the following conditions are met.

Specified by:
myProgram in interface sofia.micro.Program
Overrides:
myProgram in class sofia.micro.ProgrammableActor

removeNet

public void removeNet()
The following method below holds a statement that if the MazeRunner sees a net ahead of itself while hopping along the pathway, it will remove the nets and keep on walking along the pathway.

runAlongPath

public void runAlongPath()
The following methods below is telling MazeRunner to walk or run on the narrow pathways of the island and picking flowers, and also removing nets on the way. It is also followed with additional methods such as if it sees water ahead, turn a different direction and change routes to collect flowers and remove nets in different path ways.

runAlongPath2

public void runAlongPath2()
The following methods below is similar as runAlongPath() but instead has a statement that the code will be executed when the MazeRunner sees water on the right and sees water ahead, it will pick flowers it sees on the way while walking or hopping. The Jeroo will change direction and routes when facing water or dead end, and entering different pathways to collect flowers and remove nets.

seeNoWater

public void seeNoWater()
The following method below is telling the MazeRunner to keep walking or hopping along the pathway as long as it is clear ahead and also collect any flowers it sees ahead while walking. There is a statement declared when all the flowers are picked, all nets removed, and then when the MazeRunner ends up at the south-east of the island, it will stop there.

stop

public boolean stop()

turnAtEndRoad

public void turnAtEndRoad()
The following method below will make the MazeRunner change directions and walk in a different pathway when it sees water ahead and on either left or right, or both.
